entries.title: Data Visualisations and Analytics
entries.subtitle: (Course)
entries.description: This course teaches MSc and Honours Computer Science students the analysis, transformation, mapping and storytelling principles to build interactive Data Visualisation systems.

entries.title: Software Engineering Foundations
entries.subtitle: (Course)
entries.description: This course teaches MSc Computer Science students the basics of OOP (Java) and Software Engineering practices using GitLab.

entries.title: Foundations of Software Design and Development
entries.subtitle: (Course)
entries.description: This course taught first-year Computing students the fundamentals of algorithmic and software design in Java.

entries.title: Interactive Data Visualisations
entries.subtitle: (Course)
entries.description: This course taught Data Science students the theories behind visualising data and using interaction to handle complexity. Knowledge is put into practice with the development of interactive data visualisation dashboards with D3.

entries.title: Information Systems Engineering
entries.subtitle: (Course)
entries.description: This course taught master Computing students the principles of analysis, modelling, and implementation (C#) of software systems from a set of requirements.

entries.title: Data Analytics
entries.subtitle: (Course - Blended)
entries.description: This course taught master's Data Science students the fundamentals of cleaning, mining, and visualising data for analysis.

entries.title: Data Management and Processing
entries.subtitle: (Course - Online)
entries.description: This course taught master's Data Engineering students the development of robust and scalable data processing pipelines.

entries.title: Data Cleaning
entries.subtitle: (Invited Lecture)
entries.description: Part of the Professional Learning Programme for Colleges (organised by the Edinburgh Data-Driven Innovation (DDI) City Deal project), this session exposed Edinburgh Colleges' staff to the principles of data cleaning and data quality, followed by a practical demonstration with Open Refine.

entries.title: Document Preparation and Tools
entries.subtitle: (Invited Lecture)
entries.description: Building on my experience with previous years, I gave a lecture to Honours student on preparing their dissertation, also giving them a basic introduction on writing it with LaTeX.

entries.title: Lab Helping
entries.description: Over 7 semesters, I have helped lecturers in lab sessions for the following courses: Data Visualisation and Analytics, Language Processors, Programming Languages, and Web Design. I would also supervise some of those sessions at later dates.

entries.title: Introduction to Topic Models
entries.subtitle: (Invited Lecture)
entries.description: As part of the Data Visualisation and Analytics course, I gave a lecture on topic modelling, the mechanisms behind it, the data generated, its analyses and visualisations.

entries.title: Dissertation Writing with LaTeX
entries.subtitle: (Tutorial)
entries.description: During a series of tutorials preparing honours students to their dissertation, I introduced and demonstrated the use of LaTeX.

entries.title: Building a JavaScript MVC Architecture
entries.subtitle: (Tutorial)
entries.description: As part of the Data Visualisation and Analytics course, I demonstrated to students how to implement a simple MVC architecture in JavaScript for a visualisation dashboard with D3.js.

entries.title: D3 and JavaScript Patterns
entries.subtitle: (Q&A Session)
entries.description: As part of the Data Visualisation and Analytics course, I conducted a Q&A session on D3 and JavaScript with students, during which I explored D3's general update and JavaScript's module factory patterns.

entries.title: Assistant Professor in Computer Science
entries.description:
I mostly teach master's and honours students, with the chance of transmitting both my passions: Software Engineering and Data Science.
I also supervise Master's and Honours dissertations, typically focusing on Data Visualisation related projects.
I am the Programme Director for the MSc Data Science.

entries.title: Lecturer in Data Science and Software Engineering
entries.description:
I have taught several Computing courses across many levels: Foundations of Software Design and Development (UG year 1), Interactive Data Visualisations (UG year 3/Graduate Apprenticeship year 3), Information Systems Engineering (PG/PG Online), Data Analytics (PG Blended), and Data Management and Processing (PG Online). I also supervise Honours and Masters Dissertation projects, with a keen interest in Data Science related projects.
I also was the Leader for the BSc (Hons) Games Development and BSc (Hons) Data Science programmes, and the Computer Science subject Academic Integrity Officer.

entries.title: Research Associate
entries.description:
Following the completion of my studies, I have joined the ORCA Hub project. I am working in the Human-Robot Interaction and Explainable AI work package, investigating the visualisation and interactive explanation of automated planning.
I have also taken several teaching responsabilities.

entries.title: Research Student
entries.description: As a research student (during my Ph.D.), I have assisted the Strategic Futures Laboratory in many of their research projects.

entries.title: Lab Helper
entries.description: While pursuing my studies, I have assisted teachers during their lab sessions. I helped undergraduate and postgraduate Computer Science students, by answering their questions and giving guidance for their projects.

entries.title: Research Intern
entries.description: As a student, I was given the opportunity to work in a research environment, improving the user interface of Tinker, a proof-strategy graphs editor.

entries.title: Front-End Developer Intern
entries.description: As part of my Associate Degree, I joined Dictanova's team (now Easiware) for a three month placement, building new features for their user interface.

entries.title: Other Experiences
entries.place: Nantes and Paris, France - Garðabær, Iceland
entries.description: Before studying Computer Science, I have had various summer and part-time jobs: paper deliverer, AF reservist, and logisitic employee.

entries.title: Postgraduate Certificate (PGCert), Teaching and Supporting Learning in Higher Education
entries.description: Along with my first steps in Lecturing, I undertook this PGCert to broaden my knowledge and reflective practice as an educator. This let me achieve recognition as Fellow of the Higher Education Academic (FHEA).

entries.title: Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.), Computer Science
entries.description:
Following my interest in Data Science, Machine Learning and HCI, I did a Ph.D. in Data Visualisation and Analytics at the Strategic Futures Laboratory.

My thesis focuses on automated Topic Map visualisations, and their impact on user confidence. In particular, I have implemented and analysed the effects of data-driven explanations when used to improve user confidence. I have also observed the effects of layout characteristics, as well as algorithm features.

I was awarded the James Watt Scholarship to fund this studentship.

entries.title: Bachelor of Science with Honours (B.Sc. Hons.), First Class, Computer Science
entries.description:
After my Associate Degree, I enrolled in Heriot-Watt University's Computer Science program, which allowed me to deepen my knowledge in Artificial Intelligence, Language Processors, Computer Graphics, Lambda Calculus, Games Programming and more. In my final year I focused my expertise towards data management and visualisation, with courses like Data Mining, Machine Learning, Data Visualisation and Big Data Management.

This was complemented with a group project during my third year, which won the Scott Logic Prize. I also received a distinction for my achievements during my third year of studies.

My honours dissertation project was to create and assess a web-based interface for Tinker, a proof-strategy graphs editor.

entries.title: Associate Degree (DUT), Software Engineering
entries.place: Higher Institute of Technology (IUT) - Nantes, France
entries.description:
This two year diploma gave me strong bases in many aspects of Computer Science: Algorithmic; Object-Oriented Programming (including conception, specification, design patterns and testing); Modelisation and Formalisation; Operating Systems and Architecture; Web Technologies; Relational Databases; Networks and Security; Mathematics for Computer Science (logic, sets, statistics, arithmetic, graphs).

These technical courses were complemented with introductory courses in Communication, Economy, Accounting and Business Management, as well as group projects. Finally these two years were concluded with a three month industry placement.
